medical_history.chief_complaint: R flank pain radiating to groin, dull suprapubic pain, nausea, and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began the night prior with right flank pain radiating to groin. Duration is approximately 12 hours at presentation. Patient reports no constipation or diarrhea. There was a recent episode of renal colic 3 months ago. Initial vital signs showed low blood pressure but improved after administration of IV fluids. Symptoms of nausea and vomiting were present.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Cirrhosis with portal hypertension, varices, portal vein thrombosis, history of liver abscess, temporal arteritis on chronic steroids, hypercholesterolemia, diabetes mellitus secondary to steroids, renal colic, depression, iron deficiency anemia, osteoporosis, diverticulosis, history of hepatic abscess, left adrenal mass.
medical_history.family_history: Denies any family history of liver disease; otherwise not relevant to this hospitalization.
